university_name: The College of William and Mary
module_restrictions: Exchange students cannot take Law, Business Administration and Graduate-level courses.
visa_info: Exchange students will apply for a J-1 visa. To receive necessary paperwork to apply for a J-1 visa, students need to complete the iStart application. Students are strongly encouraged to complete the immigration paperwork at their earliest to avoid delays in visa issuance.

on-campus.additional_info: Each student must pay a refundable room damage deposit of USD $75.

on-campus.description: fraternity/sorority housing, language houses, Reves Hall (for students interested in International Studies)

meal_plan_options: varies depending on social class and living location
accommodations_info.early_arrivals: International on-campus students who arrive before designated arrival dates are responsible for finding their own housing accommodations. Temporary on-campus housing is not available.

additional_info: As a visiting exchange student, you will not be billed for W&M’s standard tuition; rather, you will continue to pay your home university’s tuition.

university_description: The College of William & Mary is a comprehensive university located in Williamsburg, Virginia. Founded in 1693, it is the second-oldest institution of higher education in the US after Harvard University. The university has a strong focus on undergraduate education and attracts students from all over the world.
location_description: Williamsburg is a city in the state of Virginia, known for its history and historic landmarks. It is a popular tourist destination and also attracts a large number of students due to the presence of the College of William & Mary. The city is located on the Virginia Peninsula and is part of the Hampton Roads metropolitan area.
